column4: Is there a meta package for the KDE 4.3.1 desktop for ubuntu 9.04?
I dont want to switch to kubuntu
there's a ppa
kubuntu-desktop will install 4.2, but you can install a ppa
for 4.3
it will be on launchpad probably, but you can Google for it
ok where can I get the urls for the ppa, ok I will google, do I have to install kubuntu?
hmm that's a point are all the ppa's on launchpad
well  I thought that's what you wanted to do, install Kubuntu?
I want to try out KDE
well  4.2 or 4.3  it doesn't matter that much which one you try
KDE  3 is nice to try even,   there's a repo that can be added for it, and there's a remix CD,  sadly KDE 3 is on the verge of dieing
I would rather use KDE 3   as my GUI than KDE 4,  but    apps  have got better in KDE 4, and well most KDE apps can run in Gnome anyway so :)
yeah I want to see how much better
hmm where's the bot
when you install kubuntu  or  the ppa for 4.3,   you will be able to log in to it from the log in screen
trying KDE in a virtual machine could be nice,  because then you can run   it inside Gnome
err vm ... hrm. :(
changing   the session to  on the log in screen to another one, is  a bit like dual booting   Ubuntu with Windows in a way,  buth  suck really
and the bot  gave the command to get rid of all the KDE packages,  if you don't want it installed anymore
have you tried xubuntu?   if not,  you may want to try that as well
trying in the current install, will do the trick
You have to use open source java I think,  since something about Sun Java being removed, also #ubuntu+1 is currrently the 10.04 channel
